Ivan Milecz über Deportationen aus Bessarabien und der Bukowina in die Ukraine im Jahr 1942

div.p: The original transcription is not available.

The Minister of Interior has published a decree about Jews today. Based on the decree, the authorities discovered that the most of the offenses against the laws and economical decrees of Warfare, together with the most of the sabotage acts and speculations, such as accumulation of medicaments, substances, wool, cotton, food, etc., are being committed by the Jews themselves. It was also discovered that many of the Jews are skipping their obligatory work tasks and are trying to ensure their existence by illegal speculations or are carrying out a subversive propaganda. Based on these findings, the Ministry of Inferior has decided to execute house searches. Jews who have been found to have accumulated supplies, or have evaded work, committed sabotage, or who are refugees from Bukovina and Besarabia will be deported with their families to areas east of the Bug River and the goods found will be.

Similar faith awaits those Jews who will leave their villages without an approval, who skipped various legal dispositions for religious reasons or those who will make any offenses against the economic order or against the state safety.

I will just add to this, that the situation of the local Jews is intensifying, since the notice gives the authorities the right to deport any of the Jews to the Russian area across the Bug. After the almost complete Aryanization of the industries, the local Jews currently earn their living almost exclusively from types of businesses which violate the economic laws and orders. Therefore, there will be a reason to accuse many Jews of sabotage. A similar reason theoretically applies to household supplying. While it is true that after the publication of this decree, the stock will disappear from Jewish households, there is not a single Christian household in Bucharest without large supply of food and other necessities, since these families do not and partially even cannot live only from the small allowances.
Made in 4 copies, 3 of them for the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and 1 copy to be stored within the records.
